org.ensembl.util
Class ConnectionPoolDataSource

java.lang.Object
  org.ensembl.util.ConnectionPoolDataSource
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.sql.DataSource
public class ConnectionPoolDataSource
extends java.lang.Object
implements javax.sql.DataSource

Connection pooling implementation of a datasource. Checks every 5 minutes for unused connections and closes them.

Author:
Craig Melsopp

Constructor Summary

          Creates new instance of the connection pool.

Constructor Detail

ConnectionPoolDataSource

public ConnectionPoolDataSource(java.lang.String jdbcDriverName,
                                java.lang.String fullConnectionString,
                                java.lang.String user,
                                java.lang.String password,
                                int maxPoolSize)
                         throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                                java.sql.SQLException
Creates new instance of the connection pool.

Parameters:
jdbcDriverName - name of the jdbc driver
fullConnectionString - connection string
user - user name
password - password, can be null
maxPoolSize - maximum connection pool size, must be >0
Throws:
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the jdbc driver can be found
java.sql.SQLException - if a problem occurs connecting to the database
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the parameters are illegal
Method Detail

getConnection

public java.sql.Connection getConnection()
                                  throws java.sql.SQLException
Gets a connection, either from the pool or a new one is created. If creating a new connection would exceed the pool size then an SQLException is thrown.

Specified by:
getConnection in interface javax.sql.DataSource
Returns:
connection from pool if one is available, otherwise a new one if the creation of the connection does not exceed the maxPoolSize.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if a problem occurs connecting to db. This includes if the number of connections will be exceeded if another is created.
See Also:
DataSource.getConnection()

release

public void release(java.sql.Connection conn)
Returns the connection to the pool. Does nothing if this connection was not created by this instance.

Parameters:
conn - connection to be returned to pool.

closeAllConnections

public static void closeAllConnections(javax.sql.DataSource datasource)
                                throws AdaptorException
Convenience method for closing connections on instances of this class, handles the fact that the datasource is null and prints a warning if it is not a ConnectionPoolDataSource.

Parameters:
datasource -
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException
AdaptorException
